name: **St John’s Island**
description: St John’s Island X413-975 Sheet 82 Another imposing steep rocky sea-stack amongst a network of the like. A lovely sea-arch cuts through its centre, passable by sea kayak at most stages of the tide. A landing is possible on the landward N side of a reef jutting E from the NE corner. Its summit awaits rock climbers of merit. It dominates the view E from Ballydowane. Ballydowane West Beach X407-977 Sheet 82 A lovely pebble beach with ample parking and good shelter, surrounded by steep cliffs. One part looks like good (but very hard) rock climbing on clean sandstone. The views left and right of needles, stacks and islands are lovely. Local enquiry suggests Ballyvoony X383-974 Sheet 82 The coast road swings right past this sheltered stormbeach with its orderly picnic tables and fine views. The steamship “Cirilo Amores” foundered here on 15th February 1925 with no loss of life. All aboard were taken ashore by Breeches Buoy.
